subject: Golf
lead_paragraph: Two golfers playing together made holes in one on the same hole. The landmark morning for Bill Maslowski and Carl Workinger came Thursday while they were playing in a threesome at Grandview Golf Course near Pittsburgh, The York Dispatch reported. Maslowski got his ace first, using a 5-iron on the 152-yard fourth hole. Steve Fahs, the other player in the group, hit second but missed the green. Workinger then used a 6-iron to hit his ball into the cup. According to a Golf Digest study, the odds of two players in the same foursome acing the same hole are 17 million to 1.
snippet: Two golfers playing together made holes in one on the same hole. The landmark morning for Bill Maslowski and Carl Workinger came Thursday while they were playing in a threesome at Grandview Golf Course near Pittsburgh, The York Dispatch reported....
